column2: Canada's Sun Life in talks to buy Assurant's unit -Bloomberg Aug 24 Canadian insurer Sun Life Financial Inc  is in talks to buy New York-based insurer Assurant Inc's employee-benefits unit for about $900 million
column4: citing people familiar with the matter.

column2: Market turmoil threatens Fed's rate hike plans WASHINGTON/NEW YORK
column3: Aug 24 Turmoil in world financial markets and growing fears of a China-led global economic slowdown threaten to derail the Federal Reserve's plans to start raising rates from near zero
column4: making the chances of a September lift-off look increasingly remote.

column2: Target settles with U.S. on charge of race
column3: gender bias in hiringTarget settles with U.S. on charge of race
column4: gender bias in hiring Target Corp has agreed to pay $2.8 million to settle a U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) charge that it used hiring tests that disproportionately screened out candidates for various professional positions based on race and gender. column2: Third Point settles with U.S. over 2011 Yahoo disclosures Aug 24 Third Point LLC
column3: the hedge fund firm run by activist investor Daniel Loeb
column4: has settled U.S. regulatory charges that it failed to properly seek antitrust clearance while it built a big stake in Yahoo Inc in 2011.
